source.author: Barker, R.M.
source.title: Sida
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Barker, R.M. (1996). Sida. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Calyx 10-angled; leaf-margins serrate for upper two-thirds, entire below; lamina dark green and glabrous above, densely white-tomentose below; mericarps 9–11, sparingly puberulent, apices widely diverging and mucronate; erect perennial to 150 cm high
Calyx not 10-angled; leaf-margins serrate or crenate for whole length; lamina not as above; mericarps 5–10, if 9 or 10, then pubescent, apices not widely diverging and mucronate
Pedicel exceeding subtending leaf; plants usually sparingly pubescent or glabrous, particularly on lower pedicel; mericarps 7–9; pubescent, erect plants
Inflorescence racemose; stipules 6–9 mm long, conspicuous; mericarps (5–) 7 or 8, pubescent
Inflorescence of solitary flowers; stipules less than 6 mm long (except sometimes in S. spodochroma which has 5 glabrous mericarps)
Twiggy, much-branched shrub with leaves 3–9 mm long and 4–6 mm wide; fruit with 5 smooth, very thin-walled and pubescent mericarps, 2–3.5 mm diam
Prostrate or erect herbs or shrubs with most leaves either longer than 9 mm or wider than 6 mm; fruit with 5–10 mericarps, if 5, then mericarps glabrous and thick-walled
Greyish-white woody subshrub with narrowly oblong or ovate leaves, 5–55 mm long, 2–8 mm wide; leaves not deeply serrate; fruits with 5 glabrous smooth mericarps, dark brown

Grey-blue or green plants with broadly oblong, ovate, or narrowly ovate leaves, more than 9 mm wide; leaves clearly serrate; fruits with 5 dark green glabrous smooth mericarps or 6–10 pubescent and deeply corrugated mericarps
Upper leaf surface green; stipules narrow-lanceolate, 0.4–0.9 mm wide; fruits flattened-ellipsoid, 5.5–8 mm diam., with 6–10 pubescent, corrugated mericarps
Upper leaf surface grey-blue; stipules narrow-linear, 0.2–0.3 mm wide; fruits broadly conical or turbinate, 3–5 mm diam., with 5 dark green, virtually glabrous, smooth mericarps; limestone areas
